node.title: 'Greed and destruction': Call for closure of all scallop fisheries
node.description: The closure of most of New Zealand's last remaining scallop beds around Auckland and Northland is being labelled a dramatic last ditch effort to save the species.

node.title: Jada Pinkett Smith makes first statement after Oscar slap
node.description: Will Smith issued an apology to Chris Rock Monday, stating that his behavior was "out of line" and "not indicative of the man I want to be."

node.title: NFL announces new overtime rules for playoff games
node.description: The new move will place less emphasis on the result of the coin toss.

node.title: Soldiers badly injured after molotov cocktail use goes wrong
node.description: Three soldiers suffered burns to their bodies during a training exercise using molotov cocktails to prepare them for peacekeeping duties.

node.title: Committee recommends no impeachment charges for South Dakota AG
node.description: The committee's party-line decision was a major setback for those trying to remove the Republican from office.

node.title: "The Flash" star Ezra Miller arrested for disorderly conduct in Hawaii
node.description: Miller was released after providing bail.

node.title: One person dead after truck crash in Tararua District
node.description: A person has died following a crash in Waitahora in the Tararua District.

node.title: Workers quitting at near record rate amid "brutal" hiring race
node.description: With almost two job openings for each unemployed worker, Americans are moving around to find better pay.

node.title: Army missed red flags about civilian leader who led child porn ring
node.description: Records show the U.S. Army and the state of Arizona missed or ignored red flags for over a decade that allowed David Frodsham to abuse his adopted son and other children.

node.title: California reparations task force at odds on who should qualify
node.description: Race-based eligibility for compensation, as atonement for slavery, would attract "hyper-aggressive challenges" committee chair says.

node.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 is now dominant in U.S., CDC says
node.description: BA.2's prevalence remains highest in the Northeast, where the agency estimates that the variant made up close to three-quarters of new infections.

node.title: Did you get a text from yourself? Don't click on anything
node.description: Verizon customers report getting spam messages that appear to come from their own phones.

node.title: White House hires full-time ASL interpreters for first time
node.description: For the first time in history, the White House has a full-time team of American Sign Language interpreters.

node.title: FDA authorizes 2nd booster of COVID vaccine for ages 50 and over
node.description: Immunocompromised Americans are also now eligible for an extra dose.

node.title: Democrats call for Clarence Thomas' recusal from January 6 cases
node.description: The 24 Democrats also asked Chief Justice John Roberts to commit to creating a code of conduct for the Supreme Court.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth returns to public view after COVID to honor her husband
node.description: The monarch was one of many members of Britain's royal family to attend the ceremony for Prince Philip in London, but a few were notably absent.

node.title: Chris Rock ticket sales spike on reseller site after Oscars slap
node.description: One ticket resale website said it sold more Chris Rock tickets overnight than it had in the past month – and prices also increased.

node.title: Mariupol residents face homelessness amid ongoing war
node.description: "They have broken everything," one Mariupol resident said. "We have nowhere to go."

node.title: Russia says it will "drastically reduce" military activity near Kyiv
node.description: With Putin's ground forces bogged down in Ukraine, his defense ministry says it will change tactics to "increase mutual trust" and give space for ongoing peace talks.

node.title: U.S. immigration agency moves to cut 9.5 million-case backlog
node.description: The measures announced by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) include allowing more applicants to pay extra fees to have their applications processed more quickly.

node.title: Former nurse found guilty in woman's medication error death
node.description: "Now when we tell the truth, we're incriminating ourselves," said the leader of a nurse advocacy organization.

node.title: Gov. Whitmer kidnap plotters "excited" about bomb, FBI agent testifies
node.description: Prosecutors say Adam Fox wanted to blow up a bridge near Whitmer's second home to thwart any police response to a kidnapping.

node.title: Taliban blocks women from flying solo, or even going to parks with men
node.description: U.S. says the Taliban's latest moves show it's "not living up to the essential commitments they made to the Afghan people and the international community."

node.title: Trump phone logs turned over to House show 7-hour gap on Jan. 6
node.description: The White House records submitted to the House show a gap in phone logs of calls placed to or by Trump from 11:17 a.m. to 6:54 p.m. on Jan. 6, 2021.

node.title: Off-duty cop fatally stabbed on Vegas Strip after argument over dogs
node.description: Edmonds Police Officer Tyler Steffins died of a single stab wound to the chest, the Clark County coroner said.

node.title: U.K. police recommend 20 fines be issued over government "partygate" scandal
node.description: Authorities have been investigating 12 parties and gatherings, some of which Boris Johnson attended, during the height of England's coronavirus lockdown in 2020.

node.title: "Terrible Tilly," Oregon lighthouse on market — for $6.5 million
node.description: The island's isolation, impossible boat landings and extreme weather as well as the lighthouse crews' dislike of their months-long stays earned the tower the nickname "Terrible Tilly." The lighthouse was also once a columbarium.

node.title: Authorities not trying to track down grizzly suspected of killing hiker
node.description: Craig Clouatre was found dead two days after he failed to return from an off-trail hike in densely forested mountains north of Yellowstone.

node.title: Suspect arrested as search for Nevada teen continues
node.description: Investigators haven't said what led them to Troy Driver, 41 but they're still looking for 18-year-old Naomi Irion, who was last seen in a Walmart parking lot more than two weeks ago.

node.title: Southland enters drought restrictions with water in short supply
node.description: Southland is grappling with an extreme dry spell that has prompted water restrictions across the region and a total fire ban.
